Title: Implementation of computer vision in detecting human poses
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, Faculty of Computing and Media, Business Information Systems Program, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Gregory, I., Bina Nusantara University, Faculty of Computing and Media, Business Information Systems Program, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Tedjojuwono, S.M., Bina Nusantara University, Faculty of Computing and Media, Business Information Systems Program, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Developing strong core muscles are important for children. Children with strong core muscles allow them to do any kinds of activities that mostly involve physical movement. The work tested on an education organisation that aims to strengthen core muscles by providing yoga-like poses. There are certified trainers that will coach the students along the way. However, mistakes could be made during the coaching because of different trainer's justification and whether the coaching processes were done correctly. Therefore, a solution is proposed to develop a computerized pose detector package which allows the trainers to improve the coaching with the students. The result is promising where the standardized pose could be implemented and compared to observed students' poses, however it is found that due to the uniqueness of the poses, it generates several unidentified results. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Children education; Computer vision; Human pose
Index Keywords: Computer vision; Information management; Muscle; Students; Human pose; Physical movements; Gesture recognition
Funding Text 1: We would like to show our gratitude to BINUS University RTTO for the support towards the research.
